content: Apple still refuses to release Watch numbers, but the device is estimated to have had a successful Holidays quarter. The Canalys research firm (all caveats hereby stipulated) pegs unit sales at 6M for the quarter with a revenue of $2.6B — that’s 80% of the total smartwatch market. Apple CEO Tim Cook, known for the reliability of his public statements, calls sales growth “off the charts”. If the numbers are accurate, Apple has become the second largest watchmaker by revenue, right behind Rolex.
